meaningMnemonic:
You've <kanji>obey</kanji>ed all that has <kanji>come</kanji> <vocabulary>up to now</vocabulary>. That's because it's the <vocabulary>conventional</vocabulary> way of doing things, and it's what's <vocabulary>conventionally</vocabulary> expected of you.

This word is a relatively formal way to talk about how things have been up to now. It's commonly used with の to modify a noun or phrase, or as an adverb.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
